paragraphs.content: Chapter 5
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 5

paragraphs.content: My son, attend unto my wisdom, and bow thine ear to my understanding:
paragraphs.contentHtml: My son, attend unto my wisdom, and bow thine ear to my understanding:

paragraphs.content: That thou mayest regard discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That thou mayest regard discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge.

paragraphs.content: ¶ For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil:
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil:

paragraphs.content: But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a twoedged sword.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a twoedged sword.

paragraphs.content: Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell.

paragraphs.content: Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable, that thou canst not know them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable, that thou canst not know them.

paragraphs.content: Hear me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from the words of my mouth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from the words of my mouth.

paragraphs.content: Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:

paragraphs.content: Lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel:

paragraphs.content: Lest strangers be filled with thy wealth; and thy labours be in the house of a stranger;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lest strangers be filled with thy wealth; and thy labours be in the house of a stranger;

paragraphs.content: And thou mourn at the last, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,
paragraphs.contentHtml: And thou mourn at the last, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,

paragraphs.content: And say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;
paragraphs.contentHtml: And say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;

paragraphs.content: And have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!
paragraphs.contentHtml: And have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!

paragraphs.content: I was almost in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I was almost in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.

paragraphs.content: Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad, and rivers of waters in the streets.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad, and rivers of waters in the streets.

paragraphs.content: Let them be only thine own, and not strangers’ with thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let them be only thine own, and not strangers’ with thee.

paragraphs.content: Let thy fountain be blessed: and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let thy fountain be blessed: and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.

paragraphs.content: Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love.

paragraphs.content: And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?

paragraphs.content: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD, and he pondereth all his goings.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the Lord, and he pondereth all his goings.

paragraphs.content: ¶ His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sins.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sins.

paragraphs.content: He shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
